title: Error with Native tracer(callTracer and prestateTracer), config parameters not working
body:
#### System information
Erigon version: `./erigon --2.36.0`

#### Expected behaviour
When calling 
{"method":"debug_traceTransaction","params":["0x123_txHash", { "tracer": "callTracer", "tracerConfig": {"withLog": true, "onlyTopCall": true} }],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}
It is expected to return the trace data with logs and only top calls.

#### Actual behaviour
This method produces the same output despite the configurations.
Run it with "withLog: true/false", "onlyTopCall: true/false" returns the same result.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
```
curl -X POST 'https://RPC-end-point/123123' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
--data-raw '{"method":"debug_traceTransaction","params":["0x315aaf3fccd98b067864d0ffaa4a2e6db98973d9dcbd31ac5e99d3e2abdd34e4", { "tracer": "callTracer", "tracerConfig": {"withLog": true, "onlyTopCall": true} }],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}'
```
You may need to alter the tx hash to trace a newer tx for non-archive nodes.

#### Backtrace
Looking into the source code, traceConfig was never passed to the trace function.
In both Erigon and Geth, the same file `call.go ` implements `callTracer`, in which
`func newCallTracer(ctx *tracers.Context, cfg json.RawMessage)`
Initialize the trace function. `cfg` is the config parameter
In Geth:
`Geth api.go: tracer, err = DefaultDirectory.New(*config.Tracer, txctx, config.TracerConfig)`
The config is correctly passed when the tracer is created

In Erigon:
```
// Erigon tracing.go:
Construct the JavaScript tracer to execute with
		if tracer, err = tracers.New(*config.Tracer, &tracers.Context{
			TxHash: txCtx.TxHash,
		}, json.RawMessage("{}"));
```
The config is just an empty array here. This is the primary reason why it is failing.

Hi @wuzhong-zhu, which chain is this for?  It doesn't look like mainnet has this transaction.

I have a potential code fix here if you're able to compile and run from a branch to verify?

It is a [transaction on Polygon](https://polygonscan.com/tx/0x315aaf3fccd98b067864d0ffaa4a2e6db98973d9dcbd31ac5e99d3e2abdd34e4). 

Appreciate your effortt ser, I can verify it.
TY!

Great!  You can check out the branch on my fork https://github.com/hexoscott/erigon/tree/tracer-config-parameters

I've just rebased this onto devel so code should be current.  I used mainnet to trace a transaction and can see that the output for `onlyTopCall: false` came to 147k and `onlyTopCall: true` came to 38k so it is now taking that flag into account.  Let me know how you get on and we can go from there 👍
Nice Work, How long Will be Merge to stable?
@CaiJiJi - I'm not sure on that just yet, have you tried the forked code to confirm it works as expected?

> @CaiJiJi - I'm not sure on that just yet, have you tried the forked code to confirm it works as expected?
I try it
Great, the PR is open already, thanks for testing from your side 👍
All merged, not sure when the next release will be but the code is in devel now.

On the BSC archive node: erigon version is v2.39.0

ubuntu@mainnet-bsc-archive-ovh-01:~$ curl --location --request POST 'http://127.0.0.1:8545/' \
> --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
> --data-raw '{
>     "jsonrpc": "1.0",
>     "id":"curltest",
>     "method": "debug_traceTransaction",
>     "params":  [
>           "0x144e9af0b6ef1c781ddebcea4a7ee00f3070cd3adbcf3d99f5d978eb18c26b6d",
>           {
>                "tracer": "callTracer","tracerConfig": {"onlyTopCall": false, "withLog": true}
>           }
>          ]
>
> }'
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":"curltest","result":null}

The problem has not been solved yet?

Hi @zhy827827, that transaction doesn't exist according to bsccan:
https://bscscan.com/tx/0x144e9af0b6ef1c781ddebcea4a7ee00f3070cd3adbcf3d99f5d978eb18c26b6d
